00022 #include <GisCommon.h>
00023 
00024 /// \brief
00025 /// GisXmlAttribute contains the name and value of a single attribute
00026 /// from an XML document.
00027 class GisXmlAttribute : public GisDictionaryElement
00028 {
00029 public:
00030     /// \brief
00031     /// Constructs an XML Attribute object
00032     /// 
00033     /// \param name 
00034     /// Input unique attribute name. If the attribute name is namespace qualified
00035     /// the name is {uri}:{localName}. Otherwise, it is {localName}
00036     /// \param value 
00037     /// Input attribute value.
00038     /// \param localName 
00039     /// Input attribute name without namespace qualification.
00040     /// \param uri 
00041     /// Input uri for the attribute namespace. L"" if the attribute
00042     /// name is not namespace qualified.
00043     /// \param prefix 
00044     /// Input prefix for the attribute namespace. L"" if the attribute
00045     /// name is not namespace qualified.
00046     /// \param valueUri 
00047     /// Input uri for the attribute value's namespace. L"" if the attribute
00048     /// value is not namespace qualified.
00049     /// \param localValue 
00050     /// Input attribute value without namespace qualification.
00051     /// \param valuePrefix 
00052     /// Input prefix for the attribute value's namespace. L"" if the attribute
00053     /// value is not namespace qualified.
00054     /// 
00055     /// \return
00056     /// Returns GisXmlAttribute
00057     /// 
00058     GIS_API static GisXmlAttribute* Create(
00059         GisString* name, 
00060         GisString* value, 
00061         GisString* localName = NULL,
00062         GisString* uri = NULL,
00063         GisString* prefix = NULL,
00064         GisString* valueUri = NULL,
00065         GisString* localValue = NULL,
00066         GisString* valuePrefix = NULL
00067     );
00068 
00069     /// \brief
00070     /// Gets the attribute's local name.
00071     /// 
00072     /// \return
00073     /// Returns GisStringP. Same value is GetName() when attribute name not
00074     /// qualified by namespace
00075     /// 
00076     GisStringP GetLocalName()
00077     {
00078         return mLocalName;
00079     }
00080 
00081     /// \brief
00082     /// Gets the attribute's namespace URI.
00083     /// 
00084     /// \return
00085     /// Returns GisStringP. L"" when attribute name not
00086     /// qualified by namespace
00087     /// 
00088     GisStringP GetUri()
00089     {
00090         return mUri;
00091     }
00092 
00093     /// \brief
00094     /// Gets the attribute's namespace prefix.
00095     /// 
00096     /// \return
00097     /// Returns GisStringP. L"" when attribute name not
00098     /// qualified by namespace
00099     /// 
00100     GisStringP GetPrefix()
00101     {
00102         return mPrefix;
00103     }
00104 
00105     /// \brief
00106     /// Gets the attribute value's namespace URI.
00107     /// 
00108     /// \return
00109     /// Returns GisStringP. L"" when attribute value not
00110     /// qualified by namespace
00111     /// 
00112     GisStringP GetValueUri()
00113     {
00114         return mValueUri;
00115     }
00116 
00117     /// \brief
00118     /// Gets the attribute's local value.
00119     /// 
00120     /// \return
00121     /// Returns GisStringP. Same value is GetValue() when attribute value is not
00122     /// qualified by namespace
00123     /// 
00124     GisStringP GetLocalValue()
00125     {
00126         return mLocalValue;
00127     }
00128 
00129     /// \brief
00130     /// Gets the attribute value's namespace prefix.
00131     /// 
00132     /// \return
00133     /// Returns GisStringP. L"" when attribute value is not
00134     /// qualified by namespace
00135     /// 
00136     GisStringP GetValuePrefix()
00137     {
00138         return mValuePrefix;
00139     }
00140 
00141     /// \brief
00142     /// Gets the attribute's qualified name.
00143     /// 
00144     /// \return
00145     /// Returns {prefix}:{localName} when attribute name is qualified by namespace.
00146     /// Otherwise, returns the same value as GetLocalName().
00147     /// 
00148     GisStringP GetQName()
00149     {
00150         return mPrefix.GetLength() > 0 ?
00151                     mPrefix + L":" + mLocalName :
00152                     mLocalName;
00153     }
00154 
00155 protected:
00156 /// \cond DOXYGEN-IGNORE
00157     GisXmlAttribute()
00158         : GisDictionaryElement()
00159     {
00160     }
00161 
00162     GisXmlAttribute(
00163         GisString* name, 
00164         GisString* value, 
00165         GisString* localName,
00166         GisString* uri,
00167         GisString* prefix,
00168         GisString* valueUri,
00169         GisString* localValue,
00170         GisString* valuePrefix
00171     );
00172 
00173 /// \endcond
00174 
00175 private:
00176     GisStringP mLocalName;
00177     GisStringP mUri;
00178     GisStringP mPrefix;
00179     GisStringP mValueUri;
00180     GisStringP mLocalValue;
00181     GisStringP mValuePrefix;
00182 };
00183 
00184 /// \brief
00185 /// GisXmlAttributeP is a GisPtr on GisXmlAttribute, provided for convenience.
00186 typedef GisPtr<GisXmlAttribute> GisXmlAttributeP;
00187 
00188 #endif
